page.title: 12QUEENBOROUGH BOAT SURVEY
page.content: On July 3rd we went and looked at the boats moored at{Queenborough Hard. We estimated that there were about 27 yachts, 52 motor boats, 2 catamarans and 7 fishing boats. There is one small slipway which reaches down to the water even at the lowest tide. As it is only about 3m wide, cars are not allowed on the slipway. Lots of people have a hard job pulling their boats up. There are few rings to tie the boat to once it is in the water. It costs Â£120 to moor your boat there for eight months. There are lots of buoys attached to chains anchored to the bottom. It is very sheltered at{Queenborough}though the tides are strong. We thought there should be more safety facilities.
